info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 7:00AM CDT until June 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Minnesota, including the following counties, eastern Faribault and Freeborn.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albert Lea, Wells, Clarks Grove, Minnesota Lake, Alden, Glenville, Geneva, Emmons, Bricelyn, Hartland, Freeborn, Mansfield, Easton, Frost, Twin Lakes, Conger, Kiester, Brush Creek, Walters and Manchester.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING
